title: Compare TUI/provider/storage crates vs ion custom
description: Evaluate rnk/ratatui/termimad for TUI stability, provider abstraction crates, and SQLite storage alternatives for ion.

logs.msg: TUI comparison: rnk 0.17.1 is active (docs.rs shows ~66.67% docs, ~25.49 kB docs, github repo ~456 stars). termimad README explicitly says it is not a TUI framework; better as markdown renderer. ratatui offers mature layout/widgets + TestBackend for rendering tests.

Provider layer: rig-core is feature-rich but still fast-moving ('Here be dragons' notice in repo). genai crate is stable lightweight multi-provider abstraction. Given ion has custom provider quirks + OAuth endpoints and is not failing in this area, custom remains best default; evaluate adapter only if maintenance cost rises.

Storage: current rusqlite store is solid; main incremental improvement is schema migration tooling (rusqlite_migration or refinery) rather than replacing storage engine. Consider libsql only if multi-machine sync/remote state is required.
